titles.title: Ginga Eiyuu Densetsu: Aratanaru Tatakai no Overture
Legend of the Galactic Heroes MOVIE (1993)
LoGH: Overture to a New War
Overture to a New War
Les héros de la galaxie - Le film 3
La Leyenda de los Heroes de la Galaxia: Obertura a una nueva batalla
OtaNW
Overture
銀河英雄伝説 新たなる戦いの序曲[オーヴァチュア]
Legend of the Galactic Heroes: Overture to a New War

anime.description: The recently ennobled http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm] who on suspicion of imperial favouritism and nepotism is facing resistance from his peers, and http://anidb.net/ch737 [Yang Wen-Li] the unwilling hero of the opposite faction, must prove their worth in the Battle of Astate... Note: The film is a more detailed retelling of the first 2 episodes of the Legend of Galactic Heroes OVA series.

tag.name: military
tag.description: The military, also known as the armed forces, are forces authorized and legally entitled to use deadly force so as to support the interests of the state and its citizens. The task of the military is usually defined as defence of the state and its citizens and the prosecution of war against foreign powers. The military may also have additional functions within a society, including construction, emergency services, social ceremonies, and guarding critical areas. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: seinen
tag.description: Seinen, literally "young man", is one of the main demographic classifications applied to manga, and, by extension, to anime, especially manga-based ones. As the name implies, seinen works are marketed primarily to an audience of young men; the age range commonly understood to be the target of such works goes roughly from 17 to somewhere in the 40s.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: future
tag.description: Anime that fall under the future category are the ones that have a society that could have originated from ours. In most cases it should go hand to hand with sci-fi since we expect the future to consist of advanced technology, however, in the case where it`s explicitly stated in the story that the anime takes place "x years into the future", the state of technology doesn`t matter as long as it`s long into the future. The anime can be set in an alternative universe not tied with our own, as long as it has a futuristic feel to it. This category sports quite a lot of anime, mostly stemming from SciFi, but not necessarily only from there.

tag.name: space
tag.description: The final frontier.

tag.name: space travel
tag.description: Space Travel usually refers going to space or travelling there with or without a spacecraft. There are different forms of space travel like Interplanetary travel, Interstellar travel or Intergalactic travel. Since it isn`t possible to travel faster than light, most anime series involve some sort "sub-space travel mechanism" as a way to travel faster than light.

tag.name: shipboard
tag.description: Beam me up, Scotty! Space stations (think Death Star) also count. Basically, this category is to tell if the setting takes place onboard a spaceship in space. This category is not applicable if the spaceship lies on a planet and never actually gets into space.

tag.name: novel
tag.description: A novel is a relatively long work of narrative fiction, normally written in prose form, and which is typically published as a book. Manga, comics, or visual novels do not fit this description and are not considered novels; including a small number of illustrations, however, is still permissible, which means that light novels are considered novels.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: politics
tag.description: From commies to fat capitalist pigs, all the stuff done by the "guys with the power", mainly evil tactics for gaining more power over the masses. Watching this title may remind you why CNN is boring.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: strategy
tag.description: Instead of blindly running into a battle or trap, at least one of the protagonists devises a clever strategy to significantly improve the odds of victory.

tag.name: remastered version available
tag.description: This anime has been remastered in a higher quality format than the original release. The remaster may be a simple upscale, or it could be a full enhancement project from the original frames. This is irrespective of whether specific groups have released rips of such formats to the internet.

tag.name: space battles
tag.description: There are space battles in this anime. Usually between Earth forces and some alien invader, but ship to ship skirmishes in deep space are just as common.

tag.name: faster-than-light travel
tag.description: Faster-than-light travel is taken for grated in this anime. This is achieved by travelling via hyperspace, nullspace, or wormholes.

tag.name: space opera
tag.description: Space opera is a sub-genre of fiction that emphasizes romantic adventures in space. Space opera generally involves large-scale conflicts between opponents with powerful abilities and technology. The genre will often be melodramatic, sometimes playing music that can be nothing short of awesome. Warfare and a battle of wits are usually less emphasized, preferring romance (with exceptions, e.g. Ginga Eiyuu Densetsu). Some space operas tend to be formulaic and sometimes even prosaic, often employing very simple devices and somewhat obvious strategies. An example of this would be the infamous laws of physics in the Macross universe, in which the main male lead will hardly ever get hit in battle.

tag.name: battle of wits
tag.description: There is some intellectual battle between the characters. They each might attempt to discern what the other knows and/or could be planning. Then, rather than simply relying on the use of raw power, try to deduce an effective strategy to foil their opponent(s). The battle of wits can be in the center of the intrigue or just a side story. Examples: Death Note, Code Geass

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Reinhard von Lohengramm
character.description: Reinhard was born into a poor noble family. He lived with his father and his older sister Annerose. His mother died when he was young so he knew very little about her. When Reinhard moved to a middle class suburban neighborhood, he met Siegfried Kircheis and they soon became inseparable friends. When his father sold Annerose to become Kaiser Friedrich IV`s concubine, Reinhard swore that he would overthrow the Goldenbaum dynasty to rescue his older sister. He left school to join the military academy and persuaded Kircheis to come along with him.

character.name: Siegfried Kircheis
character.description: Siegfried Kircheis is http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm]`s childhood friend and ally, possessing comparable military and personal ability.

character.name: August Samuel Wahlen
character.description: August Samuel Wahlen was an admiral in the Imperial Fleet, serving under http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm]. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Cornelius Lutz
character.description: Cornelius Lutz was an admiral in the Imperial Fleet, serving under http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm]. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Fritz Josef Bittenfeld
character.description: Fritz Josef Bittenfeld was an admiral in the Imperial Fleet who served under http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm] and was known for his fiery temper and aggressive battle tactics. His fleet, named the Black Lancers, was notorious for their speed and unmatched offensive power. The Black Lancers were distinguished by a black paint scheme, and used fast battleships in place of the standard battleship. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Ernest Mecklinger
character.description: Ernest Mecklinger was an Imperial high admiral who served under http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm] as the rear forces commander. Along with being an accomplished military officer, Mecklinger also was known for his artistic achievements, becoming nicknamed the "Artistic Admiral". Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Wolfgang Mittermeyer
character.description: Wolfgang Mittermeyer was an Imperial Fleet Admiral who served as the Supreme Space Fleet Commander under http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm] and was a skilled tactician, becoming one of the two "Twin Pillars" of Reinhard`s Goldenlöwe Dynasty. For his lightning-fast tactics in combat, Mittermeyer was known by the nickname of "Gale Wolf." He was a close friend of Fleet Admiral http://anidb.net/ch194 [Oskar von Reuenthal], another brilliant commander and the second member of the Twin Pillars, with whom he served as one of the two best commanders in Reinhard`s New Galactic Empire. With the deaths of http://anidb.net/ch187 [Siegfried Kircheis], Reuenthal, and http://anidb.net/ch195 [Paul von Oberstein], Mittermeyer was the last of Reinhard von Lohengramm`s early supporters against the Goldenbaum Dynasty and high nobles left alive. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Oskar von Reuenthal
character.description: Oskar von Reuenthal was an Imperial Fleet Admiral who served as the Chief of High Command Office, Governor-General of the former Alliance territory, and was one of the "Twin Pillars" of Kaiser http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard]`s Goldenlöwe Dynasty. Nicknamed the "Bewitching Eyes" for his http://anidb.net/t1065 [heterochromatic eyes], Reuenthal was a brilliant commander and was considered to be second only to Reinhard in terms of strategic ability. He was a close friend of fellow Fleet Admiral http://anidb.net/ch193 [Wolfgang Mittermeyer], the Supreme Fleet Commander and the other one of the Twin Pillars of the Goldenlöwe Dynasty. The two of them were some of Reinhard von Lohengramm`s earliest supporters against the Goldenbaum Dynasty and high nobles ruling the http://anidb.net/ch1534 [first Empire]. However, after complex scheming by various interests behind the scenes, Reuenthal ended up being forced into rising in rebellion against his Kaiser, only to fall in battle. Fleet Admiral von Reuenthal had been regarded as one of the five best tacticians of that era, and also proved himself to be a capable administrator as the Governor-General of the occupied Alliance territories. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Paul von Oberstein
character.description: Minister of Military and Internal Affairs.

character.name: Gregor von Muckenberger
character.description: Gregor von Mückenberger was an Imperial Fleet Admiral and one of three military chiefs of staff under Kaiser http://anidb.net/ch206 [Friedrich IV], during the waning years of the Goldenbaum Dynasty. Mückenberger was considered to be a competent leader and became one of the first Imperial elites to acknowledge the capabilities of http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm]. He decided to retire shortly after the death of Kaiser Friedrich IV and just before the outbreak of the civil war in the Empire, refusing overtures from the nobility of the http://anidb.net/ch6230 [Lippstadt League] to support them. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Willibald Joachim von Merkatz
character.description: Willibald Joachim von Merkatz is the high admiral under kaiser http://anidb.net/ch206 [Freidrich IV] who took refuge with http://anidb.net/ch737 [Yang] at http://anidb.net/ch1762 [Iserlohn] after the Lippschadt war. He was later forced into becoming the space fleet commander-in-chief of the Goldenbaum government in exile. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Magdalena von Westpfahl
character.description: Baroness Magdalena von Westpfahl was a close friend of http://anidb.net/ch205 [Annerose von Grunewald].

character.name: Nikolas Boltik
character.description: Nikolas Boltik was a http://anidb.net/t2322 [Phezzani] politician and diplomat who first served as the secretary of http://anidb.net/ch204 [Adrian Rubinsky] before being transferred to Odin as http://anidb.net/ch6233 [Phezzan]`s ambassador to the http://anidb.net/ch1534 [Galactic Empire]. He ended up colluding with http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm] to help him conquer Phezzan and the http://anidb.net/ch1535 [Free Planets Alliance], subsequently becoming the governor-general of Phezzan under the New Galactic Empire. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Bernhard von Schneider
character.description: Bernhard von Schneider was an Imperial commander who was most notable for his role as the leading adjutant, subordinate, and a close confidant of High Admiral http://anidb.net/ch202 [Willibald Joachim von Merkatz], serving him faithfully from at least the Battle of Astarte (796 UC) to the Battle of Shiva (801 UC). During the late Alliance–Imperial War, the Imperial Civil War, and the following standoff between the New Galactic Empire and the http://anidb.net/ch6227 [Iserlohn Republic], Schneider was essentially apolitical and was mainly loyal to High Admiral Merkatz, providing him with assistance and counseling. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Staaden
character.description: Staaden was an admiral of the http://anidb.net/ch1534 [Galactic Empire]. During the Imperial Civil War, he fought for the http://anidb.net/ch6230 [Lippstadt League].

character.name: Erlache
character.description: Rear Admiral Erlache was directly under the command of http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm] at the http://anidb.net/e7160 [Battle of Astarte].

character.name: Adalbert von Fahrenheit
character.description: Adalbert von Fahrenheit was a Vice Admiral in the Imperial Fleet. From a poor low noble background, he reached the rank of High Admiral under the http://anidb.net/ch186 [Lohengramm] regime and was the first officer of that rank to die, posthumously promoted to Fleet Admiral. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Anton Ferner
character.description: Anton Ferner was an Imperial rear admiral who became known for his role as a close aide of Fleet Admiral http://anidb.net/ch195 [Paul von Oberstein], the Minister of Military Affairs under the Goldenlöwe Dynasty. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Flegel
character.description: Flegel was a baron and therefore a high noble, and the nephew of Duke http://anidb.net/ch261 [Otto von Braunschweig]. He was involved in the imprisonment of then-Rear Admiral http://anidb.net/ch193 [Wolfgang Mittermeyer] in 795 UC, paying an interrogator to torture him and after this was unsuccessful attempting to beat him personally. His pride stung by Mittermeyer accusing him of cowardice in beating a manacled man, he released the admiral`s handcuffs to fight him fairly but was easily defeated by Mittermeyer and called for his companions to shoot his opponent. This was foiled by the personal intervention of Admiral http://anidb.net/ch1687 [Reinhard von Müsel] at the request of Rear Admiral http://anidb.net/ch194 [Oskar von Reuenthal]. Flegel cooperated with many high officers and nobles against http://anidb.net/ch186 [von Lohengramm]. In particular, he incited http://anidb.net/ch499 [Susanna von Benemünde] into plots to kill Reinhard or http://anidb.net/ch205 [his sister], all while being careful no definitive evidence could be traced back to himself. He was aboard http://anidb.net/ch1762 [Iserlohn Fortress], holding the rank of Vice Admiral under Fleet Admiral http://anidb.net/ch200 [Gregor von Mückenberger] who valued his political connections. Flegel accompanied von Mückenberger aboard http://anidb.net/ch82216 [his flagship] at the Fourth Battle of Tiamat. Following the battle, Flegel returned to Odin in 796 UC and conspired with Braunschweig to ensure that Reinhard would die in his next campaign. It was his proposal to leak Imperial plans to http://anidb.net/ch6233 [Phezzan], correctly guessing that the information would be sold to the http://anidb.net/ch1535 [Free Planets Alliance]. Having been present at the formation of the http://anidb.net/ch6230 [Lippstadt League], Flegel served his uncle as a Vice Admiral during the Imperial Civil War and died in a mutiny after insisting his ship make a suicide charge. His last words were "Long live the http://anidb.net/ch1534 [Empire]." Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Otto von Braunschweig
character.description: Otto von Braunschweig was an Imperial Duke and the husband of Kaiser http://anidb.net/ch206 [Friedrich IV]`s daughter Princess Amarie, being among the most influential high nobles at court during the waning years of the Goldenbaum Dynasty. A major opponent of the upstart http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm], he stood for preserving the old order during the Imperial Civil War. Although he possessed much wealth and military might, Duke Braunschweig proved to be incompetent and came to be viewed as the personification of the decadence and decline of the Imperial nobility. He was forced to commit suicide by his chief retainer shortly after the confederated aristocrat forces were defeated by Lohengramm. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Arthur von Streit
character.description: Arthur von Streit was an Imperial vice admiral who served as a security advisor to Duke http://anidb.net/ch261 [Otto von Braunschweig]. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Yang Wenli
character.description: Yang Wenli is one of two protagonists within the series. Like http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard], both of them share similar roles within their respective nations as famous national heroes renowned for their military skill. Compared to Reinhard, Yang is much more humble and dislikes his popularity as being a burden. Yang originally wanted to become a historian and only attended the Free Planets Defense Force Command Academy so he can get free education, while Reinhard relishes his fame and was ambitious to overthrow the http://anidb.net/ch1534 [empire]. At the start of the series, Yang has gained some fame as the "Hero of El Facil" for his exploits in the evacuation of the planet before Imperial occupation, and gains much more fame to become a national hero by the end of the first season. During the second season, he generally takes a lesser role compared to Reinhard, but returns in full force in third season before he is assassinated by members of the Terraist Church. Yang was a mild-tempered person who lives on red tea, a genius tactician and strategist that exceeds even Reinhard. His weakness lies in his unwillingness to risk democracy by assuming more direct powers and responsibilities. Not willing to take on a bigger role or responsibility, he and Reinhard`s battle were never in equal footing and at same time handcuffing him from doing things that could change the scale of the power balance. He also openly respects Reinhard and considers him to be a true genius as Reinhard`s ability does not seem to confine in just military affairs and is able to act on what his mind tells him while Yang might be reluctant to do so if given same situation. He also agrees that benevolent autocracy is better and more efficient than corrupted democracy if social change is needed, and noted that if he was born in the empire, he would actually volunteer to serve under Reinhard despite his dislike of military. On the other hand, he was glad to be born in Free Planets as it gives him the freedom, and believes that while democracy is less efficient and can be slowed dramatically with corruption it nevertheless is better because it is less likely to be corrupted completely and no one has absolute power, because after all, a good and wise Emperor such as Reinhard doesn`t come along often. The http://anidb.net/ch82015 [Hyperion] is the flagship of Yang Wenli`s fleet. It is retrofitted from a frontier security squadron flagship. It is lightly armed, possessing only 32 forward cannons which comprise its main armament. It possesses a large and spread out multi-level bridge with a large conference table commonly used for meetings by Admiral Yang and his staff, as well as a large tactical viewscreen used during battle to display fleet movements. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Jean Robert Lap
character.description: Lt. Cmdr. Jean Robert Lapp was http://anidb.net/ch737 [Yang Wen-li]`s friend from the days when they were classmates at the Officer Academy. He was held in high regard by Yang, who valued the fact that Lapp`s thoughts and methods differed from his own. He died in the http://anidb.net/e7160 [Battle of Astarte] when his ship, the http://anidb.net/ch82367 [Pergamonn], was lost in combat. He was posthumously promoted two ranks to the rank of Captain. At the time of his death, he was engaged to http://anidb.net/ch761 [Jessica Edwards].

character.name: Paetta
character.description: Paetta was a vice admiral who served the http://anidb.net/ch1535 [Free Planets Alliance] during the Battle of Astarte. He was killed during a riot at Rugpool Prison in 801 UC. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Dusty Attenborough
character.description: Dusty Attenborough is one of the commanding officers of the 13th fleet, and later, space fleet commander of the http://anidb.net/ch6227 [Iserlohn Republic]. Achieved the rank of Vice Admiral at his late twenties, even faster than http://anidb.net/ch737 [Yang]. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Julian Mintz
character.description: Julian Mintz is the adopted ward of http://anidb.net/ch737 [Yang Wenli], and a soldier of the http://anidb.net/ch1535 [Free Planets Alliance]. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Job Trunicht
character.description: Job Trunicht was an http://anidb.net/ch1535 [Alliance] politician and its penultimate head of state, leading what was widely perceived as an incompetent and corrupt administration, a symbol of the decline of http://anidb.net/ch1026 [Arle Heinessen]`s legacy. Though democratically elected, Job Trunicht used fear to maintain his power—fear of the http://anidb.net/ch1534 [Galactic Empire], and fear of his own secret police, the murderous http://anidb.net/ch82359 [Patriotic Knights Corps]. He was simply out for his own personal power and survival, becoming involved in factional politics and not caring for the future of the Alliance, despite outwardly preaching the opposite. Trunicht`s corruption was seen as one of the contributing factors to the fall of the Alliance and democracy to http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm]. After the defeat of the Alliance in Operation Ragnarök he took responsibility for the defeat and resigned, having surrendered the Alliance because his life was threatened by the Imperial Fleet. Following the complete subjugation of the Alliance during the Second Alliance–Imperial War, Trunicht made dealings with both the Church of Terra and the New Galactic Empire, ultimately betraying all of the factions that he once claimed loyalty to. Trunicht was later shot by http://anidb.net/ch194 [Oskar von Reuenthal] shortly before the latter`s own death, after having insulted Kaiser Reinhard in their conversation. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Sidney Sithole
character.description: Sidney Sithole was a http://anidb.net/ch1535 [Free Planets Alliance] flag officer. He was known for his "parallel pursuit" tactic during the Fifth Battle of http://anidb.net/ch1762 [Iserlohn] and for his mentoring of http://anidb.net/ch737 [Yang Wenli]. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Alex Caselnes
character.description: Alex Caselnes was an http://anidb.net/ch1535 [Alliance] vice admiral of logistics who served as a staff officer and close friend of Fleet Admiral http://anidb.net/ch737 [Yang Wenli]. Regarded as being an efficient bureaucrat, he was an expert in administrative and logistical work, essentially being the chief of logistics for the Yang Fleet and http://anidb.net/ch1762 [Iserlohn Fortress]. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Dwight Greenhill
character.description: Admiral Dwight Greenhill was a highly respected officer, who served as chief of staff to http://anidb.net/ch744 [Fleet Admiral Sidney Sitolet] and later to http://anidb.net/ch769 [Fleet Admiral Lazll Lobos] during the invasion of the Galactic Empire in SC 796. His daughter was http://anidb.net/ch749 [Frederica Greenhill]. He led the http://anidb.net/ch6225 [National Salvation Military Council] during the military coup d`etat on Heinessen.

character.name: Edwin Fischer
character.description: Edwin Fischer was an Alliance vice admiral who was known for his role as a close associate of http://anidb.net/ch737 [Yang Wenli], being an expert in ship manoeuvres and credited with being able to effectively carry out Yang`s tactics by coordinating precise fleet movements. He served as the vice commander of the Yang Fleet due to his abilities in coordinating ship movements. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Ansbach
character.description: Ansbach was an aide to Imperial Duke http://anidb.net/ch261 [Otto von Braunschweig], and was present at the Braunschweig estate during Marquis http://anidb.net/ch265 [Wilhelm von Klopstock]`s unsuccessful assassination attempt on Kaiser http://anidb.net/ch206 [Friedrich IV]. Ansbach sided with the nobles during the Imperial Civil War and served in the http://anidb.net/ch6230 [Lippstadt League]. He defended his lord when http://anidb.net/ch201 [Ovlesser] advanced upon Braunschweig and killed Ovlesser with his pistol. When http://anidb.net/ch254 [Braunschweig`s nephew] was killed in a rebellion on Westerland, Ansbach disagreed strongly with Braunschweig`s decision to use nuclear weapons upon the planet and instead advocated for punishing only the ringleaders of the rebellion. He was overruled and imprisoned for voicing an apparent defeatist opinion. He escaped from his imprisonment when Braunschweig had lost most of his support and was in imminent danger of capture. He disabused his lord of the possibility of alliance with http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm] or escape, and coerced his lord to commit suicide. Ansbach offered Reinhard von Lohengramm the body of Duke Braunschweig in an attempt to assassinate Lohengramm. His attempt failed but he succeeded in killing http://anidb.net/ch187 [Siegfried Kircheis]. He committed suicide with a poison capsule that he had secreted in a tooth. Despite being disillusioned, Ansbach had remained loyal to Braunschweig and his final words were of apology to his lord. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Jessica Edwards
character.description: Jessica Edwards was a peace activist and politician, and the fiance of http://anidb.net/ch739 [Jean Robert Lapp]. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Ehrenberg
character.description: Ehrenberg was an http://anidb.net/ch1534 [Imperial] Fleet Admiral and one of three military Chiefs of Staff under Kaiser http://anidb.net/ch206 [Friedrich IV]. By the time of the Lippstadt Rebellion, he was presumably forced to retire. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Steinhof
character.description: Steinhof was an http://anidb.net/ch1534 [Imperial] fleet admiral and one of three military chiefs of staff under Kaiser http://anidb.net/ch206 [Friedrich IV]. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Lao
character.description: Officer on http://anidb.net/ch741 [Dusty Attenborough]`s staff.

character.name: Sanders
character.description: Adjutant to Fahrenheit.

character.name: Pastoll
character.description: Vice Admiral Pastolle was the commander of the 4th Fleet. He was killed in the http://anidb.net/e7160 [Battle of Astarte] when his flagship, the http://anidb.net/ch82368 [Leonidas], was lost in combat.
